data.title: Moving to Lynchburg, VA – Best Place to Live in the U.S. in 2024
data.meta_description: Moving to Lynchburg, VA? Livability helps people find their best places to live, work and play. Find out why Lynchburg is a best place to live.
data.text:
Lynchburg, VABest Places to Live in the U.S. in 2024

Breathtaking views of the Blue Ridge Mountains and endless outdoor amenities are just a few reasons Lynchburg, VA, is a natural fit. Residents in Lynchburg can enjoy affordable housing, top-rated schools, a robust economy and a high quality of life without breaking the bank.

Home > Virginia > Lynchburg, VA

Lynchburg, VA

Why You’ll Love Living in Lynchburg, Virginia

Situated in the central part of the state, Lynchburg, Virginia, is a beautiful city that boasts an array of outdoor recreation options, historic neighborhoods, galleries and eateries ­– not to mention an affordable cost of living, great jobs and excellent higher education institutions. While Lynchburg is appealing to people of all ages, it is a wonderful place to enter the workforce and grow a career because the city makes it simple for newcomers to build a life they love.

Thinking of moving to Lynchburg, VA? Keep scrolling to find all the details about living in Lynchburg, including quick facts such as the population, median home value and property taxes. Plus, learn more about the cost of living and quality of life in Lynchburg, from the economy and job opportunities to weather, outdoor activities and things to do, including local restaurants and points of interest.

What Makes Lynchburg, VA, a Best Place to Live in 2024

Outdoor lovers can’t get enough of Lynchburg, VA, one of the best places to live in the U.S. The city of about 80,000 is set in the foothills of the Blue Ridge Mountains and also along the banks of the James River. That means the recreational possibilities for locals are endless, including kayaking, hiking, biking, rock climbing and more.

Lynchburg treasures its outdoor playground and ranks high for its environment. The city has a superb trail system and an ideal climate for enjoying four seasons of fun – from the fabulous fall foliage to hitting the nearby slopes in the winter and departing on fly fishing outings in the summer. The famed Appalachian Trail is also just a few miles outside of the city.

Beyond the great outdoor amenities, Lynchburg is also rich with arts and culture, and is home to several museums, a commitment to public art, and, every spring, hosts an International Festival that celebrates cultures from around the world. The city is full of historic neighborhoods and is home to more than 40 sites that are listed on the National Register of Historic Places.

While the city appeals to people of all ages, Lynchburg is a great place for young professionals to enter the workforce and grow their careers. Job seekers benefit from the region’s thriving business scene and is home to several growing industries.

The downtown area is where the past meets the present, full of local boutiques and delicious dining options, some housed in historic buildings. With its historic charm, modern amenities and welcoming community, is it any surprise that people are keen to settle in Lynchburg?

Weather and Outdoor Activities in Lynchburg, VA

What is the weather like in Lynchburg?

Lynchburg experiences four stunning seasons. The average highs and lows are 84°F and 62°F (summer) and 48°F and 25°F (winter).

Does Lynchburg get a lot of snow?

The average annual snowfall in Lynchburg is 13 inches.

Does Lynchburg get a lot of rain?

The average annual rainfall in Lynchburg is 42 inches per year, just above the national average.

How many sunny days does Lynchburg get?

Lynchburg averages 215 sunny days a year.

What are some things to do outside in Lynchburg?

Lynchburg has plenty of parks and outdoor spaces for residents to enjoy. Ride your bike or run along the Blackwater Creek Trail, a 3-mile trail on an old railway bed. Spend time along the James River at Riverside Park, which features trails, a splash pad and a train exhibit. And, for your four-legged friend, the Lynchburg Dog Park is a great spot to let your pet run off-leash.

Things To Do in Lynchburg, VA

What is something free to do in Lynchburg?

See a stellar collection of paintings and photographs at the Maier Museum of Art at Randolph College. Admission is free, but there are also some fantastic workshops for kids and adults that charge small fees. Additionally, Downtown Lynchburg comes to life on the first Friday of every month with art and music highlighting organizations that help bring art to the community.

What are some fun things to do with kids in Lynchburg?

Local kids love Amazement Square, a hands-on museum where they can form a band and rock out on stage or paint on the walls in a paint box. The museum has four spacious floors filled with interactive exhibits, workshops and educational programming. Amazement Square is also a Certified Autism Center.

What is the best open secret about Lynchburg?

Lynchburg is a historical city. It was incorporated as the Town of Lynchburg in 1805. During the Civil War, Lynchburg was used as a supply and hospital center. And if you love tomatoes, you can thank Lynchburg! Local legend says that Thomas Jefferson proved that tomatoes weren’t poisonous apples, as many people believed by eating one here.

Where do locals shop in Lynchburg?

The Lynchburg Community Market, which began in 1783, is one of the country’s longest-running farmers markets. Visitors can shop for fresh fruits and vegetables and beautiful art pieces or grab lunch at one of the many restaurant vendors. Farmers come year-round on Wednesdays and Saturdays, offering locally produced goods and specialty items.

Where is a fun place for dinner in Lynchburg?

Mizumi Japanese Bistro is the spot in town for hibachi and tonkotsu ramen.

Where is the best place for live music or performing arts in Lynchburg?

Local musicians set the soundtrack at Three Roads Brewing Company, which took over a former car dealership. The brewery also makes artisan sodas.

What is the best coffee shop in Lynchburg?

Mission House Coffee is a local Lynchburg favorite. Grab a cup of their freshly roasted, ethically sourced coffee or a salad or sandwich and spend the afternoon working in the cafe. An added bonus? They give back to local nonprofits in the community.

The Local and State Economy in Lynchburg, VA

What are the three largest industries in Lynchburg?

Lynchburg is known for its innovative environment, and several industries in the area are growing rapidly; however, the largest in the region are health care and social assistance, education, and manufacturing. More than 6,000 residents work in the manufacturing sector, which is 22% higher than the national average. Some of the largest employers include Liberty University, Centra Health and Lynchburg City Schools.

What is the sales tax rate in Lynchburg?

In 2024, the sales tax rate in Lynchburg is 5.3%.

Does Virginia have a state income tax?

Yes, Virginia has a state income tax.

Who are the major health care providers in Lynchburg?

Several highly rated health care providers are in the greater Central Virginia area, and Lynchburg residents have easy access to the Centra Lynchburg General Hospital, which is known for its cardiology department.

What colleges and universities are in Lynchburg?

Several colleges and universities are located in Lynchburg, including Liberty University, the University of Lynchburg and Central Virginia Community College.
